a101-1.resolution: wq-425 completed in B#360 (s1217). Added trace_without_intel failure mode to d049 enforcement hooks. However, s1218 (next E session after fix) still violated d049 with 0 intel entries despite engaging platforms.
a101-1.metric_before: d049 compliance at 67% (4/6 E sessions compliant). Violations: s1198, s1213.
a101-1.metric_after: d049 compliance at 50% (3/6 E sessions compliant). Violations: s1198, s1213, s1218. Worsened despite fix deployment.

a101-2.resolution: wq-426 completed in B#361 (s1219). Added session alias to directive-outcomes.json. All 50 entries now have session field populated (0 nulls remaining).
a101-2.metric_before: All 50 entries had null session fields.
a101-2.metric_after: 0 null session fields. All 50 entries have valid session numbers.

intel_volume.note: 3 of 6 E sessions produced 0 intel. Non-consecutive pattern but increasing frequency.

intel.verdict: STRUCTURAL FAILURE — d049 compliance declining for 3 consecutive audits despite 2 fix attempts (wq-416 checkpoint, wq-425 trace-without-intel). Enforcement hooks are reactive (detect after failure) not preventive (ensure capture during session).

B.note: Inflated by outliers s1199 ($7.97) and s1207 ($6.84). These cost-history values diverge significantly from session-history values ($2.27, $1.88). Excluding outliers: ~$2.00 avg.

cost.trend: STABLE — recent 10 sessions avg $1.61 vs older 10 sessions avg $2.58. Decrease driven by outlier B sessions aging out.
anomalies: s1199: cost-history says $7.97 but session-history says $2.27 — 3.5x discrepancy
s1207: cost-history says $6.84 but session-history says $1.88 — 3.6x discrepancy
s1196: cost-history says $0.45 but session-history says $1.52 — inverted discrepancy
cost.cost_discrepancy_note: cost-history.json and session-history.txt use different cost sources for some sessions. The token-calc pipeline (authoritative since wq-415/s1209) should produce consistent values. Discrepancies in sessions before s1209 are expected; discrepancies after need investigation.

critical_issues.description: d049 intel compliance declining for 3 consecutive audits (80% → 67% → 50%). Fix wq-425 was ineffective — enforcement hooks detect violations post-session but cannot prevent them. E sessions are engaging platforms but not extracting intel. This is a STRUCTURAL failure in the E session intel capture pipeline.
critical_issues.recommendation: R session needs to redesign E session intel capture. Post-session enforcement cannot fix in-session behavior. Consider: (1) Making intel capture a gated phase that blocks session completion, (2) Adding inline intel prompts during engagement rather than relying on post-engagement extraction, (3) Reducing the intel minimum to match realistic extraction capability.

recommended_actions.description: d049 compliance at 50% — declining for 3 consecutive audits (80% → 67% → 50%). Two fix attempts (wq-416 checkpoint, wq-425 trace-without-intel enforcement) both failed to improve compliance. Enforcement hooks are reactive, not preventive. E sessions engage platforms (trace written) but skip intel extraction (0 entries). This is structural.
recommended_actions.action: R session must redesign E session intel capture flow. Current approach (post-session enforcement hooks) cannot fix in-session behavior. Options: (1) Move intel extraction to an inline phase during engagement rather than after, (2) Add a pre-completion gate that halts E session if 0 intel entries, (3) Simplify the intel format so E sessions can capture observations with less overhead. Flag for R session with structural tag.

recommended_actions.description: cost-history.json has 3.5x cost discrepancies for B sessions s1199 ($7.97 vs session-history $2.27) and s1207 ($6.84 vs $1.88). These sessions occurred before and after the wq-415 token-calc authoritative cutover (s1209). The s1207 discrepancy is post-cutover, suggesting the cost pipeline may have a bug for some B sessions.
recommended_actions.action: Investigate why cost-history.json and session-history.txt report different costs for s1207 (post-cutover B session). Check if 15-cost-pipeline.sh has a code path that double-counts tokens for long B sessions.
